## Discussion

The executor may be used to compare for equality with an expected executor preference.

The lifetime of an executor is not guaranteed by an [doc://com.apple.Swift/documentation/Swift/UnownedTaskExecutor], so accessing it must be handled with great case – and the program must use other means to guarantee the executor remains alive while it is in use.

# unownedTaskExecutor

**Instance Property**

The current [doc://com.apple.Swift/documentation/Swift/TaskExecutor] preference, if this task has one configured.

## Declaration

```swift
var unownedTaskExecutor: UnownedTaskExecutor? { get }
```

## Discussion

The executor may be used to compare for equality with an expected executor preference.

The lifetime of an executor is not guaranteed by an [doc://com.apple.Swift/documentation/Swift/UnownedTaskExecutor], so accessing it must be handled with great case – and the program must use other means to guarantee the executor remains alive while it is in use.
title: unownedTaskExecutor
